ಆಗದವನು āgadavanu he who is not in good terms with another; one who is disliked; 2 a man who dislikes, hates or envies; ಆಗ(ದ)ಹೋಗದ ಮಾತು āga(da) hōgada mātu a suggestion, advice, etc. that is not practical or not useful in real situations; ಆಗಬೇಕು ಅಂತ ಇತ್ತು āgabēku anta ittu (a saying) 'something has come to happen, and there was no other way it could have happened'; 2. it was destined to happen; ಆದದ್ದು ಆಗಿಹೋಯಿತು ādaddu āgihōyitu (saying) 'forget about unpleasant things that have happened in the pasṭ; ಆಗದಿರು āgadiru to be in bad terms; to be hateful; 2. to be alien to one's taste; ಆಗಲಿ āgali a word conveying consent; 'yeś; 'okay'; ಆಗಲೀಸು āgalīsu may it happeṇ; 2. to allow to happen; ಆಗಿ āgi a reflexive suffix to denote 'oneself', ' on one's own' (ಅವನಾಗಿ, ನಾನಾಗಿ often with emphasis as in ಅವನಾಗಿಯೇ. ನಾನಾಗಿಯೇ); ಆಗಿಬರು āgibaru to be or become auspicious or favourable; ಆಗಿರು āgiru (third person, singular) to be; ಆಗಿಹೋಗು āgi hōgu to be over; to be completed; to be finished. 2. to be exhausted; ಆದದ್ದಾಗಲಿ ādaddāgali let whatever happen; let anything befall; ಆದರೂ ādarū albeit; despite; even then; although; notwithstanding; ಆದರೆ ādare but - a) on the contrary; b) yet; still; however, even then; ಆದರೆ ādare if it (so) happens; ಆದಷ್ಟು ādaṣṭu as much as possible; to the maximum extent; ಆದಷ್ಟುಮಟ್ಟಿಗೆ ādaṣṭu maṭṭige to the extent possible; as far as possible; ಆದುದರಿಂದ ādudarinda because of (that); for what happened; ಆದುದರ್ಕೆ ādudarke = ಆದುದರಿಂದ; ಆದೊಡೆ ādoḍe if it (so) happens; 2. if it happens; 3. even then; albeit; but; ಆದ್ದರಿಂದ āddarinda = ಆದುದರಿಂದ; ಅಪ್ಪಿನಂ appinam till it becomes, happens; ಅಪ್ಪಿನೆಗಂ appinegam = ಅಪ್ಪಿನಂ; ಅಪ್ಪುದರಿಂ appudarim on account of that; because of that; since it is being so; ಅಪ್ಪುದರಿಂದ appudarinda = ಅಪ್ಪುದರಿಂ: ಅಪ್ಪೊಡೆ appoḍe if it becomes, happens; ಆದರೆ ಹೋದರೆ, ಹತ್ತಿ ಬೆಳೆದರೆ ಅಜ್ಜಿ ನಿನಗೊಂದು ಪಟ್ಟೆ ಸೀರೆ ādare hōdare, hatti beḷedare a jji ninagondu paṭṭe sīre (prov.) if wishes were horses, beggars would ride; ಆಗುವುದು ಬಿಡುವುದು ದೇವರಿಚ್ಛೆ, ಮಾಡುವುದು ಬಿಡುವುದು ನನ್ನಿಚ್ಛೆ āguvudu biḍuvudu dēvara icche, māḍuvudu biḍuvudu nannicche do all you can and leave the rest to Providnce; ಆದರೆ ಒಂದು ಅಡಕೆ ಮರ, ಹೋದರೆ ಒಂದು ಗೋಟಡಿಕೆ ādare ondu aḍake mara, hōdare ondu gōṭaḍike (said of taking chances) hesitate not to stake a buck to get a billion; ಆಗಿಹೊದದ್ದಕ್ಕೆ ಅತ್ತು ಫಲವೇನು? āgi hōdaddakke a ttu phalavēnu no use in crying about the spilt milk; ಆಗುವವರೆಗೆ ಇದ್ದು, ಆರುವವರೆಗೆ ಇರಲಾರದೆಹೋಗು āguvavarege iddu, āruvavarege iralāradehōgu though waited till last stage, to become impatient at the last moment; ಆದ ಹಾಗೆ ಆಗಲಿ ಮಾದಪ್ಪನ ಜಾತ್ರೆ āda hāge āgali mādappana jātre (said as a suggestion) do what thou ought, let come what may; 2. (said about something which is being done mechanically) do without being keen or do nothave interest about its effectiveness.

ಆಚಾರವಿಚಾರ ācāra vicāra (pl.) religious or social conventions collectively, carried on by tradition and enforced by social disapproval of any violation; customs; ಆಚಾರ ಹೇಳುವುದು, ಬದನೆಕಾಯಿ ತಿನ್ನುವುದು ācāra hēḷuvudu, badane kāyi tinnuvdu they talk like philosopher, but live like fools; ಆಚಾರಕೆಟ್ಟರೂ ಆಕಾರ ಕೆಡಬಾರದು ācāra keṭtarū ākāra keḍabāradu having become corrupt, at least enjoy the benefit of corruption.
